info.name: Test script examples
info.description:
From the Postman Docs: [Test script examples](https://learning.postman.com/docs/writing-scripts/script-references/test-examples/)

> Read the documentation on the right side of each request. Look under the **Tests** tab of the request to see the test script examples. Hit **Send**, and inspect the **Test Results** on the bottom.

exec: //parse the response json and test three properties
// see examples of parsing other data in the documentation

item.name: Making assertions on the HTTP response
item.description: Your tests can check various aspects of a request response, including the body, status codes, headers, cookies, response times, and more.

item.name: Common assertion examples
Asserting a response value against a variable

exec: pm.test("Response property matches environment variable", function () {
pm.test("Test data type of the response", () => {

item.name: Asserting that an object is contained

response.name: Asserting that an object is contained

item.description:
Read on for some examples of common assertions you might find useful in your scripts, either as they are outlined below or by editing the detail to suit your own needs.

> For a more comprehensive overview of what you can include in your assertions, refer to the [Chai Docs](https://www.chaijs.com/api/bdd/).
